Title: Full Stack Software Engineer III, Supplier Advertising
RoleDescription:
Full Stack Software Engineer III, Supplier Advertising Engineering
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Toronto, Canada and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Who We Are:
At Wayfair, we harness the power of technology innovation to connect suppliers with our extensive customer base. The advertising platform is an integral part of our mission. Operating on a vast selection of sponsored items of decor, home improvement, housewares, and more, our platform ensures that suppliers can showcase their offerings to the extended audience, enhancing visibility and driving sales. Wayfair is investing heavily in building a world class advertising business. Wayfair Advertising team owns features that form the core of our onsite and offsite advertising business. We are highly motivated, collaborative and fun loving with an entrepreneurial spirit and bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment and innovate, we are growing at an unprecedented rate with a seemingly endless range of new opportunities.
Our offsite Retail Media Network is a new addition to our Supplier Advertising Experience suite. This addition allows suppliers to promote their products directly on the offsite Retail Media Network, providing customers with an enhanced shopping experience. With RMN, suppliers have increased visibility and control over their offsite advertising campaigns through a dedicated platform to manage sponsored offerings, performance and budgets.
These tasks are accomplished through cutting-edge technology stack on the Google Cloud Platform, including and Java-based microservices using the Spring Boot framework, GraphQL, and React for frontend development. If you're interested in joining a dynamic engineering team that thrives on innovation and scaling to meet increased customer demand, we'd love to hear from you.
 
What Youll Do:

Produce high quality, enterprise grade experiences
Use Java to design processes that consume/produce data and build backend applications to power Wayfair Supplier Advertising Experience platforms
Use JavaScript/React to design and build frontend applications leveraged by our suppliers to create and manage their advertising campaigns
Design and implement data processing pipelines utilizing  Google Cloud platform technologies.
Provide superior monitoring visibility to technical and operational health of the platform using DataDog
Hone your technical leadership skills as you help grow engineers on your team to develop the next generation of Wayfair engineering
Collaborate with product managers, designers, and engineers to refine product requirements, aligning development efforts with strategic business goals.
Uphold high quality standards, advocating for best practices and leading code reviews to maintain excellence in development.
Explore and implement new technologies and frameworks to enhance platform functionality and user experience.
Use ecommerce business knowledge to convert the product requirements into a technical solution.

 
We Are a Match Because You Have:

6+ years of experience in backend software engineering using object oriented language 
Proficient in Java. Nice to have: Python, Java Script.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Experience with Cloud Native architecture platforms like Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure.
Experience working with relational and non-relational databases
Experience working with event-driven architectures, DDD, and TDD
Experience and desire to work in an agile environment
Analytical mindset and passion for solving business problems with technology
Experience as a full stack engineer.
Mastery of some flavor of modern frontend frameworks and technologies like React, Redux, etc
Experience in Big Data technologies like Apache Kafka/Apache spark/Nosql databases
Preferred experience in the CI/CD tools/platforms like Buildkite/Docker/Kubernetes.
Experience in system monitoring using tools like DataDog etc.
Experience in development and technical design of frontend and backend applications from start to finish
Understanding of functional programming and javascript best practices
Experience and deep understanding of atomic design (reusable components)

Title: Software Engineer III, Global Supplier Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements. Who We Are: Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network isinherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer ordersare fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second. What You'll Do:  Take complex engineering problems, design appropriate solutions and deliver on them.  Work on a variety of technologies - from system implementations, to software and tools built in house, to application systems delivering acceleration as a service.  Implement robust, well-tested services. Provide technical design and code reviews for peers within your team.  Provide insights into opportunity areas for the platform, influencing priorities and team roadmaps in close partnership with Engineering and Product leadership. What youll Need:  Bachelor/Master degree in Computer Science or related technical subject area or equivalent combination of education and experience.  6+ years of experience in software engineering and designing systems at scale.
 Experience in development of new applications using technologies such as Java,Python or C++; SQL.  Experience building web services with Java,REST,Microservices.  Expertise with big data technologies & tools like Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto,Airflow etc.  Experience in cloud platforms such as GCP using technologies like Big Query, Dataproc, GCS, Cloud Composer, Dataflow or related technologies in AWS or Azure.  Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).  Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g.  Docker, Kubernetes, etc).  Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog,Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc.).  Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.  Strong verbal and written communication skills.  Ability to work effectively with engineers, product managers, and business stakeholders alike.  Proficient in effective troubleshooting and issue resolution techniques.

Title: Product Manager, Supplier Advertising Footprint
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 15 million items across home furnishings, decor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Suppliers are crucial partners in enabling Wayfairs mission. Within Global Supplier Technology (GST), the Supplier Advertising team owns the strategy and development of Wayfairs Supplier Advertising offerings which help suppliers boost visibility of their products and brands on our platform. This high-margin business is one of the biggest opportunities in Wayfairs profitability. 
At Wayfair, Advertising empowers suppliers to boost visibility of their products and brands on our platform. One of the biggest growth drivers of advertising is its footprint - that is, the placements where ads show up within the Wayfair site. Prominent placements enable suppliers to increase the reach of their advertising campaigns and convert more customer traffic to purchases. The Supplier Advertising Footprint team is responsible for the optimization and expansion of our ads footprint on site, while also balancing to ensure that the customer experience is not harmed.
As the Product Manager in this space, you will own our Sponsored Products footprint for sponsored product placements in Wayfair. You will lead footprint expansion efforts to test and launch new ads placements, and you will optimize footprint within existing placements, all while holding a high bar to protect the quality of the Wayfair customer experience. Achieving this will require working across all aspects of the ad serving stack, from candidate generation, to footprint decisioning, to sponsored auction ranking.
What Youll Do:

Partner with business, machine learning / applied science, and other technology teams to identify opportunities to expand or optimize our footprint through sponsored product placements.
Write product requirements for the above in collaboration with cross-functional and cross-department teams, including the ad ranking, platform, and advertiser experience teams
Coordinate with stakeholder teams owning Wayfairs website and recommendation algorithms to execute tests and launches of sponsored footprint expansions and optimizations
Work with your own engineering team to drive timely and smooth execution by performing sprint rituals like grooming, planning and retrospective.
Drive go to market for your products in partnership with internal or external stakeholders.
Define the longer-term vision for sponsored product placements, and how + when they should be used vs. other ad or organic content types on the site
Influence our thinking on how we can improve all aspects of the ad serving stack, including candidate generation and ranking, to improve ads monetization outcomes for sponsored product placements
Build and maintain product roadmap along with constantly monitoring the success and measuring the impact of your products/features.

We're A Match Because You Have:

3-5 years building software products at scale with measurable impact and ideally across multiple platforms or workstreams.
Experience with advertising or consumer-facing experiences is preferred. 
Track record of effective partnership with engineering and machine learning / applied science to drive complex cross-org initiatives and product launches
Excellent quantitative skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights and requirements. Past experience running A/B tests and making sound, data driven decisions is preferred
Familiarity with UI/UX design principles and best practices for a front-end eCommerce experience
Ability to keep up in technical conversations with both software engineers and data scientists
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to distill technical nuances into the so-what and tailor your message to the audience (cross functional stakeholders, senior leadership, etc)
A customer-centric mindset and intuition, with the ability to balance customer value between both sides of a two-sided marketplace (supplier advertisers and Wayfair customers). 
Ability to work with and influence partner teams (Senior Manager +) across various functional areas.

Title: Senior Creative Strategist – Performance Creative
RoleDescription:
Senior Creative Strategist  Performance Creative
This is a remote work position with travel expected for quarterly in-person meetings and conferences. The position can also be a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Boston HQ (Tuesday - Thursday in office, Monday/Friday remote).
Wayfairs Performance Creative team is seeking a data-driven Senior Creative Strategist to lead the development of innovative, insight-led ad creative across paid social and digital channels. This is a key role at the intersection of storytelling, design, and data, focused on producing high-performing creative that drives measurable impact across the funnel on platforms like Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and beyond.
As part of a fast-paced, cross-functional team, youll collaborate with performance marketers, designers, editors, and data analysts to translate business goals into compelling customer-facing creative. You will own end-to-end campaign ideationfrom research and messaging strategy to creative testing and optimizationensuring every asset we launch upholds brand integrity, follows channel best practices, and is built to convert.
This role is ideal for a creative strategist with 5+ years of experience in performance-driven environments who thrives on balancing storytelling with experimentation, and can bring structure and strategic clarity to a high-volume creative pipeline.
What You'll Do:

Own the Creative Strategy for Paid Campaigns: Lead strategy for ad creative across key paid channels including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, Paid Search, and programmatic. Develop insight-driven concepts tailored to platform behavior, audience mindset, and performance goals.
Drive End-to-End Campaign Development: Develop compelling creative concepts, messaging frameworks, and testing roadmaps grounded in insights. Collaborate with SEO and Consumer Insights teams to ensure strategies are data-informed, and partner with designers and producers to bring ideas to lifefrom initial edits to final delivery.
Craft and Manage UGC Briefs: Own the creation of strategic creative briefs for user-generated content (UGC) partners, ensuring content is aligned to campaign objectives, performance goals, and channel best practices.
Translate Insights into Impact: Analyze performance data and audience behavior to inform testing priorities and future creative iterations. Develop hypotheses, build testing matrices, and partner with performance marketers to continually optimize and unlock incremental performance gains.
Track and Share Creative Learnings: Monitor creative performance trends and consolidate learnings to inform future strategy. Proactively share insights and recommendations with the broader creative and marketing teams to promote a culture of continuous learning and data-driven iteration.
Cross-Functional Leadership: Act as a creative point of contact for the Marketing team, ensuring strategic alignment across creative and media plans. Present ideas and creative rationale to stakeholders with confidence and clarity.
Support Seasonal Campaign Launches: Collaborate with the Go-To-Market (GTM) team to influence and direct seasonal campaign creative, ensuring assets are optimized for paid channels and grounded in SEO insights while identifying content gaps. 
Mentor and Inspire: Help guide designers by providing actionable feedback, moodboards, and strategic direction. Champion experimentation, iteration, and scrappy production methods to maximize learning velocity.
Leverage & Repurpose Assets: Strategically utilize existing lifestyle, studio, 3D, and UGC video and static assets to scale output efficiently across channels while maintaining creative effectiveness.

What You'll Need:

5+ years of experience concepting, writing, and producing direct response ads in a fast-paced and high volume environment, such as a digital marketing agency or an in-house growth team, ideally in e-commerce or DTC.
1+ years of experience working directly with paid media (Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, etc.) as a media buyer or equivalent role, with a clear understanding of how creative impacts performance.
Experience with Facebook Ads Manager, creative testing tools, and performance reporting dashboards
A proven ability to develop and scale direct response creative that drives measurable results.
Deep understanding of platform-specific creative best practices, including Meta, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and other emerging formats.
Strong creative instincts with a focus on clarity, conversion, and audience empathy.
Experience working with graphic designers, video editors, content creators, and production teams to ship high volumes of content.
Familiarity with testing methodologies, performance metrics, and using data to guide creative iterations.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and manage multiple projects across different stakeholders and timelines.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to guide copywriters on scripts, headlines, and performance-oriented copy.
Comfort working in a hybrid, collaborative environment that values speed, curiosity, and creativity.

Portfolio or examples of past campaigns, especially those tied to performance metrics, are highly encouraged.
Bonus:

Experience with creative automation platforms or modular content systems for the consistent production of a high volume of creative assets
Prior experience in retail, home, or lifestyle categories
Interest and knowledge of cutting-edge technology such as AI-generated content and VO
Familiarity with creative tools (e.g., Figma, Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus for providing clear design feedback, but this is not a design role.

Wayfair is THE destination for all things home: helping everyone, anywhere create their feeling of home.  Own Onsite Recruitment: You will primarily serve as the face of Talent Acquisition in the store, working onsite five days a week to build strong, in-person relationships with stakeholders, hiring managers, and future team members.

As a leader in the findability operations space, we need to have a 360 degree view of key product requirements across the org, and understand the levers to pull to resolve product level or large scale issues effectively. 
We like to have fun. Our team takes time each month to celebrate our wins and toast our accomplishments.  We foster an environment that values balance, and we encourage personal development by offering a broad spectrum of opportunities for continuous development and mentorship.

Proactively identify trending issues & leverage teammates to find creative and effective solutions with a holistic approach. 
Act as the primary representative for findability operations, partnering with cross functional teams to optimize handoffs multi layered issues. 
Develop processes to hold internal teams & external vendors accountable to the data, ensuring honest invoicing practices and a seamless approval process for different types of vendor contracts.
Create and enforce guidelines for best practices for product requirements, keeping in mind ease of use for actioning teams while also providing an easily understandable experience for suppliers & internal stakeholders. 
Learn and grow the knowledge of the findability platform. Create relationships with key partners by acting as a steward of the system as a whole, helping to troubleshoot platform issues or pursuing more effective ways users can leverage the platform.
Make connections between seemingly unrelated scenarios, with an entrepreneurial spirit & mindset geared towards thinking out of the box.

Excellent communication skills (both written & verbal), with an energetic drive to build relationships with key partners & translate complex processes for a wide group of audiences.

Desire to build business plans and create strategic initiatives.

Title: Manager, Commercial Business Analytics
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
The Business Trends team collaborates with Wayfair's executive leadership and all business functions to identify, monitor, and address metric trends that drive Revenue and long-term Customer Lifetime Value (CLV). The team analyzes trends and develops a narrative on Wayfair's absolute and relative performance compared to competitors, both in the short-term and long-term. This allows Wayfair's senior leaders to quickly understand performance drivers, triage issues in real-time, and identify areas where plans need to be refined. Business Trends adds value by: 1) driving long-term CLV by unifying the organization around Wayfair's customer value proposition, tracking related input metrics, and driving interventions if customers are not reacting to improvements or if deviations from normal trends are observed; and 2) influencing partner teams to devote resources to areas of the business that need improvement in order to advance overall business performance and share taking.
The team is searching for a Manager to lead Trends for wayfair.co.uk, working directly with commercial leaders in the London office. The leader will be responsible for diagnosing overall business performance and building the narrative. In this role, you will partner closely with UK commercial leadership, including the UK GM, as well as with the wider Business Trends STO, including our Data Engineering team, to further develop self-service reporting.
 
What You'll Do

Analyse and present weekly performance insights for Wayfair.co.uk, and collaborate with partner teams to develop weekly steering decks.
Identify and analyse connections between Wayfair.com and Wayfair.co.uk trends, highlighting key similarities and differences.
Contribute to the Business Trends semi-annual roadmap.
Build and manage trackers using Google's Looker connected sheets to monitor trends for Business Trends and cross-functional partners.
Conduct cross-store investigations spanning Wayfair.com Business-to-Consumer (B2C), B2B, and Wayfair.co.uk. These can include macroeconomic pattern analysis, category/class trends, impact of policies, or experience issues.
Collaborate with peers and the Head of Business Trends to develop the monthly Trends Council narrative.
Partner with Business Trends Data Engineering to define additional needs for metrics & dimensions in the Business Trends Curated Data Layer.
Work with stakeholders to validate data insights and build hypotheses for potential interventions in response to trend deviations.

 
What You'll Need

Experience in analytical, consulting, technology, start-up, or strategy roles.
Bachelors degree from a top-tier institution with a strong academic record in economics, math, statistics, engineering, business, or a related field.
Strong analytical skills  ability to develop analytical hypotheses and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, and synthesize findings.
Strong communication skills  ability to succinctly summarize findings, create a compelling narrative, and share/align messaging with stakeholders.
Strong business acumen  ability to understand how various parts of the business interact and how macro and competitive dynamics influence these.
Ability to learn and act quickly, make decisions, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Intellectually curious, high energy, with a strong work ethic and a desire to work in a fast-paced, high-stakes team environment.
Experience with SQL or Google BigQuery is a plus.

Title: Manager, Procurement Operations
RoleDescription:
This position is a hybrid in-office role that works out of our Headquarters in Boston, MA (this role is not a virtual / remote position). 4 days in office/ 1 day WFH
The salary range (or base pay) for this position is $112,000 - $123,500 however, base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Wayfair is looking for a Manager on our Procurement Product team to drive the ongoing optimization of our cloud-based procure-to-pay system and subsequent spend processes. This highly visible role is pivotal to standardizing our firm-wide buying process, improving our downstream financial operations, tracking spend data, unlocking process efficiencies, and maximizing our teams return on investment. We are looking for adaptable doers who are great at engaging with stakeholders, questioning inefficiencies, using data to solve problems, and multi-tasking. 
As the lead Product Manager, you will need to understand the needs of cross-functional partners across finance, accounting, engineering, and the business - then translate them into a product strategy and roadmap for our suite of Procurement tools, including Coupa, Contract Lifecycle Management, and Vendor Management System. You will need to be skilled at navigating a multitude of strong ideas, selecting the ones that will drive our agenda the furthest, and communicating the priorities back to our partners. As the internal expert and guru of our procure-to-pay systems, youll then roll up your sleeves with the Procurement Operations and partner teams to get the work done. 
You will bring a strong background in Product and/or Procurement best practices and help to drive the discovery effort of new features as well as the execution of ongoing ones. This role is ideal for someone who's both business and tech-savvy and thrives in a fast-paced environment.

Create and drive a roadmap aimed at revamping our procure-to-pay system, with a focus on results and the experience of users.
Partner with stakeholders and senior leaders across departments to understand needs, identify gaps in current processes, define product design and functional requirements, and implement a system roadmap to drive business impact.
Lead the implementation of a vendor management system.
Oversee system updates and manage the ongoing relationship with our vendor; coordinate associated change management efforts as necessary.
Develop and monitor functional performance metrics (KPIs) and devise/deploy strategies for ongoing program optimization.
Create reporting suite to distribute to category sourcing and cross-functional connections to highlight trends and opportunities to reduce spend through sourcing efforts, catalog enablement, and process improvement. 
Collaborate with engineering to review, prioritize, and action system enhancement requests and reconfigurations.

What You'll Need

4+ years experience in Product Management, procurement operations/sourcing, systems management, or strategy consultancy; experience with a cloud-based P2P system is a plus.
Bachelors degree required and preferred in an analytical field, such as economics, engineering, business, math, statistics, science, or analytics.
Ability to thrive in a high growth and entrepreneurial environment where strong project management skills and the ability to juggle multiple priorities are a must.
Ability to work cooperatively and collaboratively with all levels of employees and executive management.
Articulate and persuasive communication skills, both written and verbal.
A track record of successful relationship management skills.
An ability to hit the ground running and learn quickly; a self-starter.

Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.

Title: Data Engineer III, Growth & Discovery
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
 
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
 
About the Role: 
As a Data Engineer, you will be part of the Data Engineering team with this role being inherently multi-functional, and the ideal candidate will work with Data Scientist, Analysts, Application teams across the company, as well as all other Data Engineering squads at Wayfair. We are looking for someone with a love for data, understanding requirements clearly and the ability to iterate quickly. Successful candidates will have strong engineering skills and communication and a belief that data-driven processes lead to phenomenal products. 
 
What you'll do: 

Build and launch data pipelines, and data products focussed on SMART Org. 
Helping teams push the boundaries of insights, creating new product features using data, and powering machine learning models.
Build cross-functional relationships to understand data needs, build key metrics and standardize their usage across the organization. 
Utilize current and leading edge technologies in software engineering, big data, streaming, and cloud infrastructure 

 
What You'll Need: 

6+ years relevant work experience in the Data Engineering field with web scale data sets. 
Bachelor/Master degree in Computer Science or related technical subject area or equivalent combination of education
Demonstrated strength in data modeling, ETL development and data lake architecture.
Data Warehousing Experience with Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Hive, Presto, Airflow etc.).
Coding proficiency in at least one modern programming language (Python, Scala, etc)
Experience building/operating highly available, distributed systems of data extraction, ingestion, and processing and query performance tuning skills of large data sets.
Industry experience as a Big Data Engineer and working along cross functional teams such as Software Engineering, Analytics, Data Science with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.
Strong business acumen. Experience leading large-scale data warehousing and analytics projects, including using GCP technologies  Big Query, Dataproc, GCS, Cloud Composer, Dataflow or related big data technologies in other cloud platforms like AWS, Azure etc. 
Be a team player and introduce/follow the best practices on the data engineering space.
Ability to effectively communicate (both written and verbally) technical information and the results of engineering design at all levels of the organization.

 
Good to have : 

Understanding of NoSQL Database exposure and Pub-Sub architecture setup.
Familiarity with Bl tools like Looker, Tableau, AtScale, PowerBI, or any similar tools.
